metadata.title: CVE-2023-3609 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's net/sched: cls_u32component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Iftcf_change_indev() fails, u32_set_parms() will immediately return an errorafter incrementing or decrementing the reference counter intcf_bind_filter(). If an attacker can control the reference counter and setit to zero, they can cause the reference to be freed, leading to ause-after-free vulnerability. We recommend upgrading past commit04c55383fa5689357bcdd2c8036725a55ed632bc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3609` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
